message.content:
1. First, choose a nice picnic spot that has plenty of shade and space to sit and play. This can be at a park or in the woods, or even by the river.

2. Gather up a large picnic blanket, pillows or cushions for seating, and a sturdy basket for carrying all your necessities.

3. Preparing the food is one of the most important parts of planning a picnic. Pack finger foods that travel well and don't require much preparation or utensils to eat. Some good options include sandwiches, wraps, salads in individual containers/pots, pre-cut vegetables with dip/hummus/salsa, fresh fruit (such as grapes, apples or strawberries), cheese and crackers.

4. Pack beverages such as water (bring enough to stay hydrated!), infused waters with fruit slices for added flavor (lemon/strawberry/mint), unsweetened iced tea or homemade lemonade.

5. Make some small desserts such as cookies/brownies/muffins/c
